channel.title: Is there an Item ID for
channel.description:
Is there an Item ID for a Black Partyhat? If not how can I create one for my server?
Also Dragon Whips, Rune Whips?

item.title: Is there an Item ID for
item.dc:creator: @IP1 IP
item.description:
@IP1 wrote:

Yeah. All you really need to do is find an item dumper text file, and search for the party hat ID or name in there.

You will then see some Ints and stuff. Just copy that into Class8.Java.

Yeah, as Brendan said; theres bound to be loads of tutorials.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there an Item ID for

item.title: Is there an Item ID for
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Snoop around the Downloads section, there’s bound to be some there. It takes almost no effort at all to get them up-and-running.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Incognito wrote:

Aww… Well, alright then. Thanks guys.

item.source: Is there an Item ID for

item.title: Is there an Item ID for
item.dc:creator: @IP1 IP
item.description:
@IP1 wrote:

Lol @ Brendan. Nicely phrased words ;).

Yeah, to do this; you would have to download or create your own custom client. You could then go into Class8.Java and add or edit at your will.

To spawn it, Spawn the item ID you used for in Class8.Java.

  • Matt.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there an Item ID for

item.title: Is there an Item ID for
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Those aren’t in the custom cache, although you’ll be able to spawn those providing you’re using the appropriate server and client in harmony with one another. I do hope I used the correct terminology there.

Read full topic
